title: Eve's pudding
description: Feed a crowd with this classic nursery pudding. Cook it in two large deep roasting tins if you don't have a big enough dish.

default: 40 large Bramley apples, peeled, cored and sliced

steps: Grease a very large ovenproof serving dish with 125g/4oz of the butter then scatter in the apple slices. Sprinkle over 150g/5½oz of the brown sugar, the golden syrup, cinnamon and finally the raisins.

In a mixing bowl, beat together the remaining butter and sugar in a large mixer (or with a wooden spoon) until pale and fluffy. Beat in the eggs, one at a time, then use a large metal spoon to gently fold in the flour.
Spoon the batter over the apples and gently even out with the back of the spoon.
Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until golden-brown and cooked through. Serve with custard.
